verb.description: Make an abrupt, unsteady, uncontrolled movement or series of movements; stagger.
examples: he was lurching from one crisis to the next

noun.description: An abrupt uncontrolled movement, especially an unsteady tilt or roll.
examples: the boat gave a violent lurch and he missed his footing

origin: Mid 16th century (denoting a state of discomfiture): from French lourche, the name of a game resembling backgammon, used in the phrase demeurer lourche be discomfited.
